intro: Oenothera tanacetifolia, commonly known as golden-rod nightshade, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and prairies. Oenothera tanacetifolia is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for various health purposes.
